company.title: 7th Beat Games
company.description: We make hardcore one-button rhythm games!

history.text: Two childhood friends and Malaysians, Hafiz Azman and Winston Lee, decided to make a little Flash game in the summer of 2011 while studying in university in the UK. It was their first time doing game development, driven solely by this game idea, and every summer and winter holiday from that point on was spent on this game. During the Christmas holidays of 2012 they finally released an early demo on TIGSource in a thread called 'Rhythm Doctor - a tough-as-nails rhythm game!'. To their surprise it was well-received! On a whim they decided to enter it for the IGFs the following year. To their (bigger) surprise they were selected! That was the year they set foot on US soil for the first time.
At GDC, they met Giacomo Preciado, a programmer from Peru, and he joined as 7th Beat Games' third member. Today after graduation, the three work on the game from their respective home countries.

award.description: PC Gamers' Top 50 Free Games of All Time

quote.description: The base mechanic and premise of Rhythm Doctor are gold for me. Rhythm is in everything, and I'm glad the developers found it in medicine.

quote.description: A genuine masterclass in rhythm game design.
quote.name: Laura Kate Dale

quote.description: Even if you've checked it out before, please try this new build. It's deliciously difficult, and that's really what keeps me coming back.

quote.description: a rad Rhythm Paradise-esque browser game (...) sadistically difficult.
